problems.text: A bacteria population doubles every hour. If there are initially 3 bacteria, how many bacteria are there after 8 hours?
problems.hint: This is a geometric sequence. Each hour the population is multiplied by 2.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: An investor deposits $1000 at 5% interest per year compounded annually. What is the total after 6 years?
problems.hint: This is a geometric sequence. Each year the amount is multiplied by 1.05.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A ball is dropped from 2 meters and bounces to 3/4 of its previous height each time. How high does it bounce on the 5th bounce?
problems.hint: Each bounce is 0.75 times the previous height.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A tree grows 10% taller every year. If its current height is 5 meters, what will be its height after 7 years?
problems.hint: Each year the tree multiplies its height by 1.1.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A savings account deposits $500 each year, and each deposit earns 6% compounded annually. How much will the 10th deposit be worth after 10 years?
problems.hint: Each year, the value multiplies by 1.06. Use the formula for the 10th term.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A fungus grows at a rate of 1.5 times its previous size every day. If it starts at 2 grams, what is its weight on the 9th day?
problems.hint: Each day, the fungus multiplies its weight by 1.5.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)
